abstract.p: Roundup of recent advertising account changes (S)

block.p: * Environmental Protection Agency to the Danvers, Mass., office of Bozell Kamstra, part of the Bozell Group unit of True North Communications, to handle its national Energy Star account along with the Cadmus Group, Waltham, Mass., an energy and environmental consulting company. Spending for Energy Star, which encourages consumers to buy energy-efficient appliances, was estimated at $35 million for a five-year contract. The previous agency was the Dallas office of DDB Worldwide, part of the Omnicom Group.

* Healthcite, Baltimore and Chicago, an Internet technology and connectivity services company, to Leo Burnett USA, Chicago, part of the Leo Burnett Worldwide unit of the B Com3 Group, as agency of record to handle its first account. Billings were estimated at more than $40 million. LeoHealth, another Burnett unit, will also work on the account along with Williams-Labadie, which is minority owned by Burnett.
